meanings.definition: A small cord or thread used in embroidery.
meanings.sent1: She carefully threaded the cordonnet through the fabric.
meanings.sent2: The dress was adorned with intricate cordonnet stitching.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the cordonnet, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like delicate cordonnet, weaving a beautiful story.
meanings.sent5: The cordonnet added a touch of elegance to the design.

meanings.definition: A decorative trim or edging made of twisted cord.
meanings.sent1: The curtains were embellished with a golden cordonnet.
meanings.sent2: The pillowcases had a lovely cordonnet border.
meanings.sent3: The chef creatively used cordonnet as a garnish on the dish.
meanings.sent4: The music was like a cordonnet, adding a finishing touch to the event.
meanings.sent5: The cordonnet trim made the outfit stand out.

meanings.sent1: She decided to cordonnet the edges of the tablecloth.
meanings.sent2: The designer cordonneted the dress to give it a unique look.
meanings.sent3: He cordonneted his speech with humor to engage the audience.
meanings.sent4: The artist cordonneted the painting with intricate details.
meanings.sent5: The chef cordonneted the dessert with a swirl of chocolate.
